perturbation.original_text: 2.04 “Company” has the meaning set out above in the introductory paragraph.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.04 “Company” has the meaning set out above in the introductory paragraph and also refers to any subsidiaries or assigns related to Rare Element Resources Ltd.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Company' narrowly. The modification expands the definition to include subsidiaries and assigns, which contradicts the initial narrow definition and creates uncertainty about which entities are bound by the contract obligations specific to 'Company'.

perturbation.original_text: 2.12 “Investor” has the meaning set out above in the introductory paragraph.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.12 “Investor” has the meaning set out above in the introductory paragraph and includes Synchron, its equity holders, and any third-party beneficiaries as explicitly identified by Synchron in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text narrowly defines 'Investor'. The modified text expands 'Investor' to encompass equity holders and unspecified third-party beneficiaries. This contradicts the original specific definition and introduces ambiguity because the rights and obligations for 'Investor' now become unclear for these additional, undefined parties.

perturbation.original_text: 3.06 Investor will not disclose to Third Parties any unpublished Technical Information furnished by Company to Investor during the term of this IP Agreement, or any time thereafter; provided, however, that disclosure may be made of any such Technical Information at any time (i) with the prior written consent of Company, (ii) to Affiliates of Investor, (iii) to Third Parties, in confidence, if and when the Option is exercised before the expiration of the Option Period, (iv) after such Technical Information has become public through no fault of Investor, (v) if such Technical Information is received from a third person who had a right to disclose it, (vi) if Investor can show such Technical Information was independently developed without access to any such Technical Information, or (vii) if Investor can demonstrate such Technical Information was in its rightful possession free of any obligation of confidentiality prior to its first receipt from Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.06 Investor will not disclose to Third Parties any unpublished Technical Information furnished by Company to Investor during the term of this IP Agreement, or any time thereafter; provided, however, that disclosure may be made of any such Technical Information at any time (i) with the prior written consent of Company, (ii) to Affiliates of Investor, (iii) to Third Parties, without confidence, if and when the Option is considered viable by Investor's legal counsel, (iv) after such Technical Information has become public via Investor channels, (v) if such Technical Information is received from a person, (vi) if Investor can show such Technical Information was developed, or (vii) if Investor can demonstrate such Technical Information was in its possession.
perturbation.explanation: The original text strictly prohibits Investor from disclosing unpublished Technical Information to Third Parties and provides for very specific and narrow conditions that allow Investor to overcome its disclosure obligations. The modified text now allows Investor to disclose unpublished Technical Information to Third Parties without confidence, publicize the information via Investor channels and remove the condition that Investor must show that it developed or possessed the information prior to receiving it from the Company. This significantly changes the Investor's obligations and creates contradictions.
